snippet.title: Melbourne weather makes life hard for PNG in AFL International Cup
snippet.content: The defending champions Papua New Guinea have lost their opening match in the 2017 AFL International Cup, going down to arch-rivals Ireland 41-30. Fiji have started the tournament off in fine style with a thumping win over France by 80 points to 14. AFL South Pacific Development Manager Ben Drew says the tournament is off to a great start, despite the Melbourne weather, and the men's match between PNG and Ireland has set the standard.
